text:
Welcome!
=====
\
I am an Assistant Professor in the Centre for Interdisciplinary Methods at the University of Warwick. I teach on the Data Visulization MASc as well as several other course at CIM and Warwick.
\
I am a co-author of the Atlas of Finance and on the forthcoming book Doing Open Social Science: A Handbook for Researchers, along with other academic publications
\
I update this website sporadically with blog posts, tutorials and other tidbits. You can also follow me on Mastodon, bluesky or LinkedIn.
\
You can find more out about me here.
=====


Latest Notes & Writing
=====

title: About
text:
I have a PhD in Sociology from the LSE where my research looked at the information infrastructure of land registration in England and Wales and ‘offshore’ property ownership.
\
Before this I studied for a MPhil in Modern Soceity and Global Transformation at Cambridge University and BA in International Relations and Security Studies at the Univerity of Bradford.
\
After completing my PhD I moved onto Oxford University where I worked as a Research Associate in Finance and Geography as part of the CityNet Team.
\
Prior to starting at Warwick I was an Associate Lecturer in Geography and Data Visualisation at UCL where I taught Cartography and Data Visualisation to undergraduate and masters students. While teaching at UCL I also worked as CIVICA Open Social Science Researcher at the LSE.
\
I am currenlty working on the ESRC funded project ‘Can Digital Goods be Neutral? Evaluating OpenStreetMap’s equity through participatory data visualisation’ with Dr Carlos Cámara-Menoyo.
\
You can find out more about my publications here
=====
I built this website with quarto. It does not collect or record any information.
